meanings.definition: To specialize in a particular subfield within a larger field.
meanings.sent1: She decided to subspecialize in cardiology after completing her general medical training.
meanings.sent2: Doctors who subspecialize often have in-depth knowledge in a specific area of medicine.
meanings.sent3: The chef subspecialized in making the perfect omelette, much to the delight of breakfast lovers everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to subspecialize in problem-solving made her an invaluable member of the team.
meanings.sent5: The artist subspecialized in capturing the beauty of sunsets in her paintings.

meanings.definition: Having specialized in a specific subfield within a larger field.
meanings.sent1: The subspecialized surgeon was known for his expertise in minimally invasive procedures.
meanings.sent2: The subspecialized training allowed her to focus on a particular aspect of the industry.
meanings.sent3: The cat, with its subspecialized skill in catching mice, was the hero of the barn.
meanings.sent4: Her subspecialized knowledge of ancient civilizations made her the go-to person for historical questions.
meanings.sent5: The subspecialized team of researchers made groundbreaking discoveries in their field.
